intro: Leptochilus serratus, commonly known as the serrated rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, serrated leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom in early spring. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine and subalpine regions. Leptochilus serratus is a perennial herb that is well adapted to cold, arid environments.
